instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No power on...
threads.message:
Using a 60W charger because 85w got shorted out the other day...
Unit will not power on F7040 Shows 2.5 volts on meter.. Diode mode shows .153 Which is kind of a short? 
I traced back F7040 it comes from pin 23 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> which reads 2.5 v as well and the same .153 on diode mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No power on...
threads.message: It'll never power on from a 60W, but F7040 should have 12.6V. Check sense resistor circuits from <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> and get a 85W charger that is actually an 85W
